Name: Block Showing a Woman's Face
Description: This limestone block, sculpted in sunken relief, was once part of a wall in a tomb chapel. It is carved in the curved-line, vital, sensuous, late Eighteenth Dynasty style. It depicts a woman's face and part of her chest. The lady on the block appears to be mature and forceful. She wears a long wig topped by lotus flowers and buds. It is bound at the top with a wide floral fillet, or ribbon. The neck is adorned with a large collar. The woman holds the Hathor-headed sistrum, or rattle, and the Menat necklace. The artist combined the low relief of the whole figure with the raised relief
